llama2_direct_sole-planning_results:
Of course! Based on the information provided in the query, I have designed a 5-day travel itinerary for you and your companion starting from Durango and visiting two cities in Texas - San Angelo and Amarillo - from March 27th to March 31st, 2022.

Day 1 (March 27th): Durango to San Angelo (approx. distance: 802 km, duration: 7 hours 36 mins)

* Take a flight from Durango to San Angelo in the morning. (Cost: $40)
* Check-in at a hotel in San Angelo and freshen up.
* Have lunch at one of the Indian restaurants in San Angelo, such as Kake Da Hotel or Yumbuns. (Cost: $15-$20 per person)
* In the afternoon, visit the Nest, a local artisan marketplace with unique gifts and souvenirs. (Free admission)
* Have dinner at a Chinese restaurant in San Angelo, such as Henri's Bar or Maakhansingh. (Cost: $20-$30 per person)

Day 2 (March 28th): San Angelo sightseeing and food tour

* Start the day with breakfast at a local café, such as Kitchen King or Priya Panchvati. (Cost: $10-$15 per person)
* Visit the San Angelo State Park for some outdoor activities, such as hiking or birdwatching. (Admission fee: $7 per person)
* Have lunch at a local bakery or café, such as The Headquarter or Costa Coffee. (Cost: $15-$20 per person)
* In the afternoon, embark on a food tour of San Angelo's Chinese and Indian restaurants. (Cost: $30-$40 per person)
* Have dinner at a local Indian restaurant, such as Kake Da Hotel or Self-driving from San Angelo to Amarillo (approx. distance: 492 km, duration: 6 hours 57 mins).

Day 3 (March 29th): Amarillo sightseeing and food tour

* Take a flight from San Angelo to Amarillo in the morning. (Cost: $80)
* Check-in at a hotel in Amarillo and freshen up.
* Have breakfast at a local café, such as Taxi or The Flatiron. (Cost: $10-$15 per person)
* Visit the Amarillo Zoo for some animal encounters. (Admission fee: $17 per person)
* Have lunch at a local bakery or café, such as Self-driving from Amarillo to Durango (approx. distance: 1,155 km, duration: 10 hours 57 mins).
* In the afternoon, embark on a food tour of Amarillo's Chinese and Indian restaurants. (Cost: $30-$40 per person)
* Have dinner at a local Indian restaurant, such as Kake Da Hotel or The Flatiron. (Cost: $20-$30 per person)

Day 4 (March 30th): Amarillo to Durango (approx. distance: 1,155 km, duration: 10 hours 57 mins)

* Check-out from the hotel in Amarillo and drive back to Durango. (Cost: $20-$30 per person)

Day 5 (March 31st): Durango sightseeing and food tour

* Start the day with breakfast at a local café, such as The Flatiron or Self-driving from Amarillo to Durango (approx. distance: 802 km, duration: 7 hours 36 mins).
* Visit the Durango Discovery Museum for some interactive exhibits and learning experiences. (Admission fee: $10 per person)
* Have lunch at a local bakery or café, such as Kitchen King or The Headquarter. (Cost: $15-$20 per person)
* In the afternoon, embark on a food tour of Durango's Chinese and Indian restaurants. (Cost: $30-$40 per person)
* Have dinner at a local Indian restaurant, such as Kake Da Hotel or The Flatiron. (Cost: $20-$30 per person)

Budget Breakdown:

* Flights from Durango to San Angelo and Amarillo to Durango: $160
* Hotel accommodations for 4 nights: $640
* Food and drinks for the entire trip (excluding flights): $875
* Total budget: $2,385

Note: The budget breakdown is an estimate based on the information provided in the query. Actual costs may vary depending on various factors such as flight schedules, hotel availability, and personal preferences.
